page.title: 12RECENT HISTORY.
page.content: {The American Airfield-Rustington { }Mary Taylor, the authoress, told us that an airfield was built in Rust- ington in 1918. It covered 159 acres where Preston Avenue is now. The First World War ended before it was built. Mrs. Taylor wrote to the American Embassy for information. The Pentagon sent a microfilm of all the relevant documents, including details of how to build the Handley Page 0/400 Paralyser the bomber which would have flown from the airfield. A railway led into the airfield but it was not removed properly and remains are still being dug up. The guard-house and salvage shed remain, changed into houses. Two hangers were removed to Littlehampton and are still used as boat sheds.
